options.option_text: Process 1 and Process 2 will enter their critical sections simultaneously,leading to race conditions.
Process 1 will always enter its critical section before Process 2.
Process 2 will always enter its critical section before Process 1.
Deadlock can occur if both processes try to enter their critical sectionssimultaneously.

questions.question_text_1: Assume that two processes P1 and P2 are using a shared resource. If P1 and P2 are both waiting indefinitely to enter their critical sections because each keeps waiting for the other to release the resource, then which of the following conditions is not satisfied?
question_texts: Assume that two processes P1 and P2 are using a shared resource. If P1 and P2 are both waiting indefinitely to enter their critical sections because each keeps waiting for the other to release the resource, then which of the following conditions is not satisfied?

questions.question_text_1:
What is the correct sequence of tasks that takes place during hardware interrupt handling? 
(i) Save the current CPU state (ii) Identify the interrupt source (iii) Execute the interrupt service routine (ISR) (iv) Invoke the kernel scheduler if needed (v) Restore the CPU state and resume execution
question_texts:
What is the correct sequence of tasks that takes place during hardware interrupt handling? 
(i) Save the current CPU state (ii) Identify the interrupt source (iii) Execute the interrupt service routine (ISR) (iv) Invoke the kernel scheduler if needed (v) Restore the CPU state and resume execution

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is a disadvantage of the Shortest Job First (SJF) scheduling algorithm?
question_texts: Which of the following is a disadvantage of the Shortest Job First (SJF) scheduling algorithm?

options.option_text: It always leads to the highest average waiting time
It does not consider burst time while scheduling
It can cause starvation for longer processes
It executes processes in a strictly Round-Robin manner

questions.question_text_1: State True or False: In inter-process communication (IPC) using shared memory, the commonly used system calls are send and receive.
question_texts: State True or False: In inter-process communication (IPC) using shared memory, the commonly used system calls are send and receive.

questions.question_text_1: Given the hexadecimal view of the first few bytes of different files, identify the executable file (ELF file) from the options below. (Hint: The ASCII value of ’E’ = 69, ’L’ = 76, and ’F’ = 70)

questions.question_text_1: What is the main drawback of a priority-based scheduling algorithm?
question_texts: What is the main drawback of a priority-based scheduling algorithm?

options.option_text: Average waiting is more for higher priority process

questions.question_text_1: Choose all the correct statements regarding compiling and linking multiple C source files using gcc.
question_texts: Choose all the correct statements regarding compiling and linking multiple C source files using gcc.

options.option_text: The command gcc file1.c file2.c -o output produces an executable namedoutput.
The command gcc -c file1.c file2.c -o output produces an executable namedoutput.
The command gcc -c file1.c file2.c produces file1.o and file2.o.
The command gcc file1.o file2.o -c -o output produces an executable namedoutput.
The command gcc file1.o file2.o -o output links the object files into anexecutable named output.
